{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking if the scale, or size, of the study matters when identifying racial disparities in breast cancer mortality. In general, the scale of a study can greatly impact the results. Larger studies can provide more accurate results and can better identify disparities. Smaller studies may not have a large enough sample size to accurately identify disparities. Therefore, the scale does matter when identifying racial disparities in breast cancer mortality.", "answer_choice": "A"}
